thread.title: Casino de Montréal's Cabaret reopens

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Casino de Montréal's Cabaret reopens
text:
Casino de Montréal's Cabaret reopens   
Sep 03, 2015 eTN   
MONTRÉAL, Canada - The Casino de Montréal's Cabaret will reopen tomorrow, Thursday, September 3. And teams of people are busily working to prepare the final details. "We are all awaiting the Cabaret's grand opening show. And who better than living music legend Tony Bennett to do the honours, serving up an unequalled entertainment experience in this unique performance hall!" exclaimed the Casino's General Manager, Kevin Taylor. 
The reopening of the Casino de Montréal's Cabaret will be marked by a unique series of shows throughout the weekend. Following Tony Bennett performance tomorrow, the Cabaret will play host to the likes of the talented André-Philippe Gagnon on September 4 and popular singer/songwriter Gino Vannelli on September 5. What better way to launch the season's calendar! 
One casino, two performance venues 
Gregory Charles' Le Qube, with its capacity of 800, adds to the programming. In fact, the media premiere of Plamondon will be presented there today. The Casino de Montréal is set to host an exceptional array of shows and entertainment of all kinds. 
About the Casino de Montréal 
Opened in 1993, the Casino de Montréal is an international calibre establishment as well as a masterpiece of Montréal architecture. Already Canada's biggest casino, it is now one of the most modern in North America. The Casino provides visitors with a wide-range of exciting entertainment options, including shows, restaurants, bars, lounge areas, even more games and, as always, exceptional customer service. 
Important dates September 2: Plamondon, Le Qube (media premiere) September 3: Tony Bennett, Cabaret du Casino September 4: André-Philippe Gagnon, Cabaret du Casino September 5: Gino Vannelli, Cabaret du Casino September 9: Cabaret burlesque, Cabaret du Casino (media premiere)
